did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.unittitle: George Stafford and John Beddoe Business Records
did.abstract: Business letters of two merchants in Geneva, New York; with some receipts and personal letters.

bioghist.head: Biographical History
bioghist.p: George Stafford (d. 1832) was an American merchant and co-owner of the firm Stafford and Beddoe in Geneva, York. He married Charlotte Beddoe on January 24, 1828 in Utica. Charlotte was the daughter of John Beddoe, Stafford's future business partner. George Stafford died on January 15, 1832 at the age of 34.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents of the Collection
scopecontent.p: The George Stafford and John Beddoe Business Records contain correspondence and financial records of the American businessmen. The correspondence in the collection consists of both business and personal letters, while the financial records are receipts for the firm Stafford and Beddoe.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: The collection contains two series: Correspondence and Financial Records.
